value: "Le Paon se plaignant à Junon" from La Fontaine's Fables

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Scene from La Fontaine's fable, showing Juno seated on a bank of clouds, hand out-stretched toward a peacock.
"Les Oreilles du Lieure" from La Fontaine's Fables

value: Horizontal rectangle. Scene from La Fontaine's fable, showing a rabbit seated near a stream looking at his shadow.
"Le chien qui lache sa proie pour l'ombre" from La Fontaine's Fables

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Scene from La Fontaine's fable, showing a dog standing on a plank bridge, a piece of meat in his mouth, regarding his reflection in the water.

label: Description
value: Elaborate rocaille design for an upholstered chaise lounge, with textile drapery at sides, a vegetal finial at the top, and a book stand with candle holder to one side. A woman is represented in the background.

label: Description
value: Very small oval-shaped bandbox. Paper is probably wallpaper: chalky-white flowers and leaves picked out in bright green. Small black dots are sprinkled over a portion of the design. The cover is edged with a fluted design, shaded with dark gray.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on handmade paper, cardboard support

label: Provenance
value: Owned by Catherine Staples, whose name is on the box. Her family lived in New Haven at the corner of Elm and Church Streets. (See donor's letter April 30, 1948.)
Church of St. Paul the Apostle, New York City, Chancel Decoration

label: Description
value: A perspective view of the interior looking toward the sanctuary. Behind the altar, the rendering of the wall decoration is incomplete. Above the wood paneling, one section of the painted decoration is indicated, right. The decoration of the apse is complete. Only one window design rendered.

label: Physical description
value: Watercolor, gouache, over graphite on buff-colored thick wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of L. Bancel La Farge

label: Description
value: A round body with long slender neck on low, banded foot. Two thin, applied collars on neck and two incised bands at lip. Strap handle. Colorless salt glaze on white body, encircled from neck to base by incised blue-glazed leafy branches with relief dots in groups of three.

label: Physical description
value: Salt-glazed stoneware, incised and relief decoration

Design for the North Wall of the Music Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of a section of the north wall, showing two of the large wall-paintings, the one at left with a scene of pagodas and bamboo trees, terminated at the top by a coiled snake in low relief. A narrow panel at right, with an ornamental painting terminated above by a winged dragon in low relief.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

label: Description
